name: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2485
Reason: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole has a melting point that we will compare to benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a methyl group, two additional phenyl rings, and a pyrazole ring. The methyl group adds approximately +10°C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The additional phenyl groups contribute approximately +20°C each due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight. The pyrazole ring introduces additional rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +30°C.
